thread.title: Mike Pence Was ‘Disappointed’ To Learn He’d Been Misled By Gen. Flynn Over Conversation With Russian Ambassador
thread.title_full: Mike Pence Was ‘Disappointed’ To Learn He’d Been Misled By Gen. Flynn Over Conversation With Russian Ambassador

author: Kaitlan Collins
title: Mike Pence Was ‘Disappointed’ To Learn He’d Been Misled By Gen. Flynn Over Conversation With Russian Ambassador
text:
TOP 5491730 
Vice President Pence was “disappointed” to learn he had been misled by Mike Flynn about his conversation with the Russian ambassador. (Photo: Aaron P. Bernstein/Getty Images) 
“I am very grateful for the close working relationship I have with the president of the United States,” the vice president said during a press conference with European Union Council President Donald Tusk when he was asked about President Trump waiting two weeks to tell him about what happened. 
“I would tell you that I was disappointed to learn that the facts that had been conveyed by Gen. Flynn were inaccurate. We honor his long service to the United States of America, and I fully support the president’s decision to ask for his resignation. It was the proper decision. It was handled properly, and in a timely way.” 
Pence said he had “great confidence” in the administration’s national security team. 
WATCH: . @KThomasDC asks @VP re: Flynn: Did you feel like officials misled you Assurances it won't happen again? Pence: "Disappointed" in situation pic.twitter.com/eum0gygZ6u
